contentrichtext.text: [[File:Unagisakihocho.EelKnife.jpg|thumb|60px|Regular Unagisaki hocho (photomontage).]] An {{Nihongo||鰻割き包丁|'''unagisaki hōchō'''}} is a knife specialized for filleting [[eel]].<ref name=Thompson>{{cite book|last=Thompson|first=Lisa|title=Creating Cuisine: Have You Got What It Takes to Be a Chef ?|year=2008|publisher=Compass Point Books|isbn=0-7565-3625-1|pages=28|url=http://books.google.cz/books?id=QR40hiPihiIC&pg=PT15&dq=unagisaki+hocho&hl=cs&ei=DVnZTtmDK8q2hQfWjZ3YDg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=book-preview-link&resnum=2&ved=0CD4QuwUwAQ#v=onepage&q=unagisaki%20hocho&f=false}}</ref> The sharp tip of the knife is pushed into the eel near the head, and then slid along the body of the eel to open up the entire length of the fish.<ref name="Japanese Kitchen Knives">{{cite web|last=Japanese Kitchen Knives|title=Unagisaki Hocho (Eel)|url=http://japanese-kitchen-knives.com/japanese-knife-types/unagisaki-hocho-eel/|publisher=Japanese Kitchen Knives|accessdate=3 December 2010}}</ref> Besides the standard version as shown in the picture, there are also local styles that differ significantly for different cities in Japan like [[Nagoya]], [[Osaka]], and [[Kyoto]].<ref name="Japanese Kitchen Knives"/> ==See also== *[[Japanese cutlery]] *[[List of Japanese cooking utensils]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Unagisaki Hocho}} [[Category:Japanese kitchen knives]] {{Japan-cuisine-stub}}
